cab.content: SECRET.BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 4th AUGUST, 1918.1. WESTERN FRONT.(a) French Front, Between SOISSOWS arid RHEIMS the enemy la stubbornly resisting the Allied advance, especially East of FISMES, and has counter-attacked at GARENNE DE GUEUX. Attacks by the French last night to take FISMES and BRAINE were unsuccessful. The French have pushed patrols across the River VESLE North-west of JONCHERY and occupied the Farm of LES VENTEAUX and also 7/est of BRAINE where LA GRANGE Farm is now in their possession, otherwise there is no change in the line as reported at noon. North of MONTDIDIER French patrols have been stopped at CASTEL., MORISEL and BRACHES. South of the last-named place the French hold the following line: FILESCAMFS Farm (East of AUBEV1LLERS) - MALPART - LA FOLIE Farm (South of MALPART) - FRAMICOURT WOOD - FONTAINE SOUS MONTDIDIER -East of MESNIL ST. GEORGE to old line, (k) British Front, There is no change in the general situation, but HAMEL is reported to bo clear of the enemy and the Railway cutting South-west of ALBERT on the ALBERT-AMIENS Road is in our hands.2' ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.There is nothing to report,General Staff,War Office, S.W.1. 4th August, 19180Issued at 6,45 p.m.
